result.execSummary:
The defendant Denise M Rupcic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain/obtain full time employment and/or school.

Provide DNA sample if not already done so.
Defendant is NOT to be involved in running any fundraising events.

Follow through with Mental Health care.
Sign all necessary releases regarding medical and psychiatric care.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time (nonworking hours) Standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

Notice from DOC that defendant is deceased.

ADDRESS INFO for Denise M Rupcic
Current: 316 E Northwater St. #9, Silver Lake, WI 53170 United States  (Effective: 06-08-2015)
Prior: 1374 West Post Rd, Genoa City, WI 53157 United States
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Denise M Rupcic in court with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State orally amends Count 1 to Theft-Movable Property contrary to Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).  State to file Amended Information within 24 hours.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Defendant updates address.

Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year 6 months, Extended Supervision: 1 year 6 months) STAYED
- 3 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $278.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
- Conditions of Probation:  Follow through with Mental Health Care.  Sign all necessary releases regarding medical and psychiatric care.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Defendant is not to be involved in running fundraising events.
CONDITION TIME: 5 months - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED for use by Agent.
